step1.sentence: After ten years in accounting, she decided to branch out and start her own consulting business.

step2.story: Miguel had been a software developer for years, but he felt stuck doing the same work every day. When a friend invited him to co-teach a weekend coding bootcamp, he saw it as the perfect chance to branch out. That first class sparked a passion for education he never knew he had.

step3.story: Yuna's bakery had been famous in the neighborhood for its sourdough bread for over a decade. Customers loved it, but she couldn't shake the feeling that she was playing it too safe. One rainy afternoon, she sat down with her notebook and sketched out ideas for a whole new menu — pastries inspired by her travels through Southeast Asia. Her husband raised an eyebrow when she told him she wanted to branch out beyond bread. "It's a risk," she admitted, "but I need to grow." Within six months, her pandan croissants and ube tarts had people lining up around the block.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '가지를 뻗다'라는 뜻으로, 나무가 새로운 가지를 내밀듯 활동 범위를 넓히는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 기존에 하던 일이나 분야에서 벗어나 새로운 영역으로 확장할 때 사용합니다. 사업 확장, 새로운 취미 시작, 커리어 전환 등 다양한 맥락에서 "영역을 넓히다, 새로운 분야에 도전하다"라는 의미로 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 나무의 가지(branch)가 줄기에서 뻗어 나가는 모습에서 유래한 비유적 표현입니다. 18세기부터 사업이나 활동의 확장을 묘사하는 데 사용되기 시작했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 도전적인 뉘앙스를 가진 표현입니다. 안전한 영역에서 벗어나 새로운 것을 시도한다는 의미가 담겨 있어, 용기와 성장의 느낌을 줍니다. 격식체와 비격식체 모두에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The company plans to branch out into the European market next year.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 회사는 내년에 유럽 시장으로 영역을 넓힐 계획이다.
